gurmukhi: Gumy bRxM ] BRmy rxM ] ljM Psy ] ktM ksy ]497]
transliteration: Ghoume Baranan|| Bhrame Ranan|| Lajan Phase|| Katan Kase||497||
translation: The wounded warriors are wandering and writhing in the battlefield; they are feeling shy in being entrapped, having been girdled.497.

gurmukhi: Duky DkM ] tuky tkM ] Cuty srM ] ruky idsM ]498]
transliteration: Dhouke Dhakan|| Touke Takan|| Chhoute Saran|| Rouke Disan||498||
translation: The throbbing of the hearts continues, the arrows are being discharged intermittently and the directions are being hindered.498.

gurmukhi: ie`k ie`k Awruhy ie`k ie`kn kh q`kY ]
transliteration: Ikk Ikk Aaruhe Ikk Ikkan Kah Takkai||
translation: The warriors excelling one another are coming and looking at each other one by one;

gurmukhi: ie`k ie`k lY clY ie`k kh ie`k auc`kY ]
transliteration: Ikk Ikk Lai Chalai Ikk Kah Ikk Ouchakkai||
translation: They are moving with each one and are being startle by each one;

gurmukhi: ie`k ie`k sr brK ie`k Dn krK ros Br ]
transliteration: Ikk Ikk Sar Barakh Ikk Dhan Karakh Ros Bhar||
translation: On one side they are discharging arrows and on the other they are pulling their bows in rage;

gurmukhi: ie`k ie`k qrPMq ie`k Bv isMD gey qir ]
transliteration: Ikk Ikk Tarphant Ikk Bhav Sindh Gad Tar||
translation: On one side the fighters are writing and on the other side the dead ones are ferrying across the world-ocean;

gurmukhi: rix ie`k ie`k swvMq iBVYN ie`k ie`k huAY ib`JVy ]
transliteration: Ran(i) Ikk Ikk Saavant Bhidain Ikk Ikk Huai Bijjhde||
translation: The warriors excelling one another have fought and died;

gurmukhi: nr ie`k Aink ssqRx iBVy ie`k ie`k AvJV JVy ]499]
transliteration: Nar Ikk Anik Sastran Bhide Ikk Ikk Anjhad Jhade||499||
translation: All the warriors are alike, but the weapons are many and these weapons are striking blows on the soldiers like rain.499.

gurmukhi: ie`k jUJ Bt igrYN ie`k bbkMq m`D rx ]
transliteration: Ikk Joojh Bhat Girain Ikk Bakhannddmaddh Ran||
translation: On one side the warriors have fallen and on the other they are shouting;

gurmukhi: ie`k dyvpur bsY ie`k Bj clq Kwie bRx ]
transliteration: Ikk Devpur Basai Ikk Bhaj Chalat Khaae Bran||
translation: On one side they have entered the city of gods and on the other, having been wounded, they have sped away;

gurmukhi: ie`k ju`J au`JVy ie`k mukqMq bwn kis ]
transliteration: Ikk Jujjh Ujjhde Ikk Vijjhde Jhaar As||
translation: Some are fighting in the war firmly and on the other side they are falling down having been chopped like trees;

gurmukhi: ie`k Aink bRx JlYN ie`k mukqMq bwn kis ]
transliteration: Ikk Anik Bran Jhalain Ikk Mouktant Baan Kas(i)||
translation: On one side many wounded are being endured and on the other the arrows are being discharged with full strength;

gurmukhi: rx BUMm GUm swvMq mMfY dIrGu kwie lCmx pRbl ]
transliteration: Ran Bhoonm Ghoom Saavant Mandai Deeragh(u) Kaae Lachhman Prabal||
translation: Diraghkaya and Lakshman have wounded and created such a situation in the battlefield,
